body.head: Frederick E. Auslander (*June 30, 1910, New York; †Nov 1981, Liberty, NY)

div.p: American music teacher, whose parents, Joseph and Jeanette Auslander, were born in Hungary. He enlisted for war service on November 27, 1942.

div.head: Auslander and Schenker
div.p: Auslander was a student of Hans Weisse, studying Schenkerian theory at the David Mannes Music School in New York. In January 1933, he approached Schenker for permission to translate into English one or other of Schenker's works in conjunction with Weisse, and three months later with a more modest proposal for part-translation. Weisse at the time expressed doubts as to Auslander's theoretical and linguistic abilities; and Ernst Oster, who visited him, described him much later as having been quite unsuited to the task. The plan came to nothing

div.head: Correspondence with Schenker
div.p: The two letters from Auslander to Schenker survive as OC 18/29 and 30 (1933); see also OC 18/31; also referring to Auslander is OC 18/32 (Weisse). Replies by Schenker are not known to survive.
